TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Environment extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides properties to determine what runtime environment was used to open the form template.

remarks.para: Use the property of the class to access an object you can use determine which runtime environment and program was used to open the form template for editing.

The class provides the and properties which enable you to determine what editing environment was used to open a form template. If both properties return false, the form template was opened in Microsoft InfoPath. If either property returns true, the form template was opened from an appropriately configured document library on Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010 running InfoPath Forms Services in the program for the corresponding property: a Web browser ( property) or a mobile browser ( property).

example.para: In the following example, a basic pattern is shown for checking the values of and properties to conditionally run code depending on which environment and program was used to open the form.
example.code: If (Me.Environment.IsBrowser) Then ' Code to run if form is open in a Web browser. ElseIf (Me.Environment.IsMobile) Then ' Code to run if form is open in a mobile browser. Else ' Code to run if form is open in the InfoPath application. End If

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsBrowser As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsBrowser { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether the form template was opened from InfoPath Forms Services in a Web browser.
Docs.value: true if the form template was opened from InfoPath Forms Services in a Web browser; otherwise false.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: See the code sample in the class topic.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsMobile As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsMobile { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether the form template was opened from InfoPath Forms Services in a browser on a mobile device.
Docs.value: true if the form template was opened from InfoPath Forms Services in a browser on a mobile device; otherwise false.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: See the code sample in the class topic.
